question: Which international financial institution remarked that Asia is expected to grow at 0 percent in 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic?
explanation:
The International Monetary Fund (IMF) has recently announced that Asian region is expected to grow at 0 percent in 2020 due to COVID-19 pandemic.
The institution also remarked that this would be its worst growth performance in the past 60 years. This estimate has been released in the blog titled 'COVID-19 Pandemic and the Asia-Pacific Region: Lowest Growth Since the 1960s'. IMF recently estimated Indiaâ€™s growth rate at 1.9% in the current financial year.
